etymologies: mid 19th century (in derris (sense 2)): modern Latin (genus name), from Greek, ‘leather covering’ (referring to the plant's leathery pods)

definitions: an insecticide made from the powdered roots of certain tropical plants containing rotenone.
shortDefinitions: insecticide containing rotenone, made from powdered roots of certain tropical plants

definitions: a woody, climbing plant of the pea family that bears leathery pods and has tuberous roots from which this insecticide is obtained.
shortDefinitions: woody climbing plant of pea family, which has tuberous roots from which insecticide derris is obtained
